Reviews.Title: “Ultra shabby in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bidibodi
Reviews.Content: ok..it's probably my fault..when I see "boutique hotel" I always dream of a tiny clean and warm place, maybe hidden but cosy and nice Patou it's on a great location if you are a museum freak (I'm am!!) and also on a shopping street, but since the beginning it has been disappointing I received an email after my booking where they ask me to communicate them my arrival time..??? I've tried several times to call them without no one picking up the phone..I was a little bit worried also Maybe I booked a ghost hotel.. After several attempt some one finally answered and they told me that the hotl reception was closed after 7pm.. on my arrival I had the familiar sensation of claustrophobia that I always have on tiny Amsterdam hotels..the door was greasy and pitiful andso the compressed aisle . The room could have been worst but again thesloppy cleaning and the rippen towel leave a faulty feeling to this experience

Reviews.Title: “Dusty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: James P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived and had to knock on the door of the cafe downstairs and attract the attention of the person sweeping up. Internet was not working. No TV in the room. Room dusty. Woken frequently throughout the night as windows were no insulation from the sound of passing revellers, cars and bikes etc. Cafe opens at 8.30am - too late for us to have breakfast and get to our appointments. Cursory making up of room. No proper reception. Ambivalent about lack of TV. Overall fairly rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket, boutique hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: John L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After booking in with a friendly and enthusiastic receptionist we were shown to a loft room in a minimalistic style. The bathroom and bedroom were tastefully decorated and cleaned to high standards. The only suggestion I may have would be to have tea/coffee making facilities within the room - however there is a boutique restaurant below the hotel. The hotel is situated on a quiet shopping street with upmarket designer stores and located approximately 25 mins leisurely walk from Amsterdam Central train station.We found this to be a perfect location for ourrequirements. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: KARL T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the Hotel at all and I would recommend it to anyone. I do have a complaint about Easy to Book though and wish to warn other customers. When booking and viewing Prices in British Pounds the rate was good. However, after booking the Hotel Easy Book added on Extra Hidden Fees making the Price rise much higher than they advertised. I ended up being charged Â£20 more for my stay and I have complained to Easy Book who are now just ignoring me. SO my advice, use the Hotel, it's a good standard but DO NOT BOOK through EasyBook's website

Reviews.Title: “The right idea but a refurb is much needed”
Reviews.Author: kayleighwilliams
Reviews.Content: Some friends of ours recommended this hotel after their own successful trip earlier this year. Having read the reviews, we were somewhat cautious of making the booking but took our friends' advice and booked. Unfortunately, the reviews below really do reflect the reality of the hotel. To summarise: 1. Location - next to Louis Vitton and opposit Chanel but no shops to buy a bottle of water (even the restaurant that is part of the hotel would not sell a bottle of water to us as they had just turned the 'closed' sign). 2. Reception - there is now a room functioning as the reception area but it is next to the kitchen - I've never experienced such an over-powering smell of chip fat which also filled the corridors. However, we were grateful of being able to check-in at 10.30am rather than 3pm - not a sign of a busy hotel! 3. The room - a "deluxe" room booked - good attempt at modern style but in desperate need of refreshing. The black furniture was extremely dusty, the curtains were cardboard panels that have curled and were stained and the TV had clearly been cleaned very carelessly leaving large smears. Our wardrobe had electrics in the top corner which were extremely noisy. However, the bedding was very clean and smelled freshly washed. 4. Bathroom - very clean and smart. No complaints here. 5. Noise - although the hotel is on a quiet street in terms of night life, there appeared to be traffic all night long. Very noisy. Overall, I would not return. Other friends have recommended Park Hotel which is nearby and apparantly worth the extra few Â£Â£Â£.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: yehiaCairo
Reviews.Content: first the hotel have no reception, the images are misleading and the pluming system was not working, so i moved to an attic room with no shades, so i used to wake up with the early morning light, and while i was leaving there was no one at the reception to check me out, its a very poor hotel, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “never ever be tempted to stay here even if it is the last room available”
Reviews.Author: thislinda
Reviews.Content: Booked through a 'boutique' hotel company -very misleading as not even up to hostel standards. I cannot say enough to explain just how awful this was. Reasons not to stay: Locked and closed on arrival at 9pm -Took a man from a sister hotel two hours to come and let us in. It smells terrible -sewerage. Totally unsafe stairs -steep and no handrail and unclear fire exit. There was no key to our room -they left us the master key. there were NO staff on the site. The minbar was broken and mouldy. The brasserie was shut. There was an open fuse box in wardrobe. freezing cold -no heating on in room [November] . it seems we were the only guests [luckily for everyone else!]. It was filthy. cowboy botch job on the building. We went and waited in a nearby hotel for the man to let us in and the staff there said it happens all the time and people just chek out and go round the corner to them once they see the rooms. It was 11.15pm by the time we got in our room and so it was too late to find anywhere else [and the one round the corner had no room] but first thing in the morning we left. They have said they will not charge us but we need to see the credit card bill before we know for sure. I truly do not know how they can get away with it -or who the people ar who have given good reviews?? Maybe they got a v. cheap deal -we didn't -and we were in a deluxe room! Just awful even for free I would not stay again -ever.

Reviews.Title: “potentially great, staff, maintenance and service horrible”
Reviews.Author: ellusionnl
Reviews.Content: Our stay: This is a real shocker. A wonderfully designed (small but very efficient) boutique hotel located right at the hart of the best known fashionstreet of amsterdam and holland. When build probably looked great but bad materials, bad construction, bad cleaning and general lack of management really took it's toll. It does smell a little funny as mentioned earlier, there's cracks in almost every wall and there isn't a piece of wall unscarred by run-ins with luggage. The room looked great but the wooden floors throughout the hotel weren't picked to withstand intensive hotel use, they look dirty now. They're stained by years(?) of usage. The bathroom looked wonderfully designed with large sheets of white marble but the seams were brown / moldy. An uncovered air-vent was overgrown with mold and in plain sight. Also there was no hot water in the morning when we wanted to take a shower. The bed was clean and sheets were nice but the bed-lights didn't work (one was missing a bulb, the other didn't work). Checkout trouble: At checkout, there was no staff at the reception. After 5 minutes i went to the lunchroom downstairs of the hotel (same name also connected by internal stairs) to ask if i could check out. I was told i had to go to the reception in a -figure it out yourself- tone. When i responded i was there for 5 minutes without someone showing, the waitress responded she (the waitress) had just been upstairs and the reception was staffed. She repeated this several times in an very nasty tone of voice implying i was lying. She added 'i don't know how to do a checkout' hoping i would go away. After i got really angry, got told a had a big mouth, i went upstairs to leave the key and prepared to just leave ( they had my credit card details). Another waitress came in and very franticly made a phonecall to get the receptionist back. I got a quick apology and was asked for my credit card again (something wrong with their administration- really?). I told them i thought it would be a good idea to have some things repainted and fixed i was told they knew that should happen. A quick apology and a request for my signature for the payment please. I don't know what's going on here but this is a disgrace to the name of the street. Please restore the original idea, change the staff and as i'm not the first to complain here probably the management as well. A boutique hotel should be great at it's design. Service can be very basic as long as it's with heart. General impression: There's too much wrong to overlook even at a fairly reasonable price for the location and intended ambiance. we will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Puzzeling”
Reviews.Author: Ritefix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a shopping high street about a 25 minute tram ride from the city centre. While the hotel is attached to a coffee area the entrance passageway to the hotel was cramped, the carpet dirty, we were welcomed to an open fuse box, and there was an unpleasant smell in the air (which continued throughout our stay â€“ really putrid!). The lift was extremely cramped an opened up to a strange reception area, which was dark with a desk plonked 2 paces away from the lift. At first I wasnâ€™t sure whether I had arrived in reception or one of the floors! The customer service was ok. The corridor leading from the lift to the rooms was extremely pleasant - really fresh, light and clean, nice dÃ©cor a large mirror and there was a trendy locking system for the doors. We stayed in the attic room which was quaint; I really liked that you could push the windows right open and get a nice breeze. The bed was really comfy - a really nice level of comfort! The room was a mixture of modern design, with a cosy feel and the wood beams on the ceiling were really pleasant. On the negative side - the bathroom was in need of some minor repairs e.g. cracked tiles a smelly sink and a shower that was blasting hot!!! The lighting system was a bit too cleaver - in fact the lights could not actually switch off, they just went to a lighter shade!! This resulted in me wearing an eye mask as I was too tired to take it up with reception. We could not get a connection to the internet from our room which was frustrating, as that was a feature of the package which I was keen to utilize. When we checked out 2 of us got in the lift and the carriage dropped significantly I was so freaked out and spend the next two minutes panicking as to whether the lift would hold out!!! I had never been so glad to enter the reception. On the plus side the receptionist asked me if I was ok, and was savvy enough to offer to take our luggage down in the lift personally so we could use the stairs which I was really grateful for! The hotel ordered a taxi for us which came on time and cost 37 Euros. It was an experienceâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: guest120
Reviews.Content: From the moment we set eyes on it we knew it was a no-hoper. The entrance photograph on their website is of some other building, definitely not the shabby single door entrance existing. The small hallway about 10ft x 2ft had black filthy carpet that had not seen a hoover for months. Unsurprisingly there was no plug socket for a vacuum to function. Into a tiny lift that accommodates three at a squeeze, but two people plus weekend bag comfortably. Communal hallways scuffed, marked, unvacuumed and scruffy. Room on first impression were modern and tidy, if small. But it was all form over function. The shower in white/grey marble were extremely narrow and perilously slippery when wet measuring only 59cm across so if you are on the large side ( which I am not) you will have a real problem entering the shower. The glass doors to the bathroom area were heavy and you had to manouevre to the sink whilst squeezing through the door. Cleaning of the rooms did not happened over the three days we were there, Beds were made only. Breakfast food was left in the rooms all day and night and even after numerous requests they be cleared, we had to leave them in the hallway ourselves. Common areas had a few weeks of grey fluff/dust/dirt everywhere. On the second night we were pursued halfway up the Hooftstraat by the restaurant manger who was filling in for the hotel manager if we could let in the next guests( who happened to be our friends on a late flight as there were no staff to check them in at 10pm!) If that was, we hadn't anything planned - like dinner for instance! Ho hum. The location is fine if you want to be in Chanel all day, and close enough to the major museums etc, but not to hang around to let unwelcomed guests in especially as the hotel cafe/bar was closed all day and night Friday - so our friends had to come bags and all straight from the airport to the restaurant we were eating in some twenty minutes away. The alternative being to leave the restaurant to return to the hotel to let them in and return to dining later. Extraordinary to take bookings when you have NO staff to check in guests. First time I've ever seen that. The street is noisy every morning early though Sunday morning, unsurprisingly was quiet. A great weekend on the sightseeing front, but the hotel really left a blot on the experience. Horrid. Horrid. Horrid. Although they explained this had never happened before (yeah right) and gave us a 40 euro discount per night, the damage was done. Shall not return.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: Find-a-gem
Reviews.Content: There is some negative feedback online about this hotel so I wanted to put a very positive review up and to go on record as having had a great stay there. I was there for 3 nights in a room that was everything the website claimed it would be. The receptionist was lovely - I didn't find the entrance hard to locate, the bed was comfortable the bathroom clean and tidy and the overall decor of the room was simple and elegant. The room was a good size, there was ample storage and the free safe in the room was most useful. Great location .... if ever I came back to Amsterdam I'd come back to this hotel if I could get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Nahdiaa
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel online and it looked glamourous, chic and elegant. We arrived and from the moment we got there, it was unclear where the hotel entry was. It is located in the brasserie, so up we went! The receptionist was lovely and helpful, but the rest of our stay was not up to standard. The first thing I noticed was the hallways were dirty and chipping. Our room was clean, but the furnishings were dirty. The continental breakfast was rubbish, at 12,50 euros, we got cardboard bread with one slice of cheese. That is NOT a continental breakfast. We go downstairs and what should we see but the hotel cleaner was on the stairwell of the brasserie and kissing her bf while on the job. The staff of the brasserie were unprofessional and uninterested. I did tell this to the receptionist and she didnt charge us for the breakfast. Please, do not be fooled by it's gorgeous website!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again - Caution Caution”
Reviews.Author: NomadPLB
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in an amazing location, the web site is great and that is it. Ok it is a "design" hotel - the air conditioning does not work, the place including the brasserie is filthy, the staff are unprofessional - The fire exists are blocked, the greasy smell from the brasserie flows up to the rooms. The stains on the walls are not pleasant. I travel a great deal, this beats the worst of travel !!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Truely Amazing!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LinaDenver
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no clue where all the bad reviews come from. This hotel is absolutely amazing. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the receptionist and where guided up to our room where she showed us the room and asked us if everything was to our liking. Wow, what a nice room! Beautifully designed with a lot of black wood, marble sinks and a very expensive looking shower. The room was very clean and I have never slept so nice in a bed as in this bed. The breakfast in the morning was everything a person needs in the morning, especially the fresh orange juice. The hotel is just a stroll away from all the touristic attractions and the museum square is not even a 2min walk. Surrounded by beautifull shops and whithin walking distance from leide square, the flowermarket etc. I would like to recommend this hotel to everyone who is interested in some luxury for a very reasonable price and a great location. Thank you Hotel Patou for our great holliday!

Reviews.Title: “Most terrible hotel I ever been in contact with......”
Reviews.Author: debbyTH
Reviews.Content: I booked a room last month at Hotel Patou and this was already weeks in advance. I had a party in Amsterdam and called in the afternoon whether they will be open 24 hours. The guy at the hotel confirmed and said we could check in at any time. After the party at 1.30 AM when we wanetd to checked in, we found the hotel locked and no one at the reception. After trying to get in touch with the hotel we were disgusted to find out that we had to stay at another hotel, which of course at that time charged us a rack rate at premium level. the next day we went to Hotel Patou to explain and the girl at the desk explain to us that the guy in the nightshift was ill and therefore they locked the hotel...can you ever imagine. They knew we were still coming and they have put this in their logbook. I asked for the manager in charge and was told her name was EVA..I send EVA an email and gave her a chance to get back to me prior to this message. She DID NOT even take her time to answer back to me. So Eva...problems just dont go away they need to be solved. Never ever stay in this hotel it is also dirty and looks they do not ever fix anything

Reviews.Title: “Nice location BUT DIRTY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Gip
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days and THEY'VE NEVER CLEENED OUR ROOM! They didn't change the garbage in our room.. once the cleaner asked if we want to change the towels, we replyed "yes" but she didn't come back with new towels! nice location but dirty!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenniferboden
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hidden hotel flanked by Chanel and Louis Vuitton on the most fashionable street in Amsterdam. Lovely, modern, luxurious rooms, the hotel is the best in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: Cece67
Reviews.Content: From the minute we stepped into the reception area we understood that this was not going to be a great success. And right we were! The website (from which we picked this place) is a blatant case of mis-representation. The website does in no way reflect reality. The hotel is dirty, walls were full of black humidity stains, the bathrooms were dirty and very run down, the staff is everything from useless to openly unpleasant. We had one room on the second floor and the kids had a room on the attic. The heating did not work in one of the rooms, and nothing was done to repair it. Another room was available we were told, but no heating in there either. Finally, we had to go down to reception (telephones did not work either) to ask for extra blankets. When in the taxi to go to the restaurant that night, we heard from the taxi driver that the hotel staff had complained to him about us. Upon checking out the next morning, we finally got a sustantive reduction of both rooms. The manager of the hotel was probabaly used to such conversations as none of our comments seemed to interest her or make any kind of impression on her. I strongly recoomend that you stay away from this place! The price of 185 euros for a night is a outright scandalous.

Reviews.Title: “Chique and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: BarSpy69
Reviews.Content: A friend told me to stay in Patou Amsterdam. Been there with my wife for two nights (a shopping and museum weekend). Lovely room, elegant bathroom, nice staff with adequat information.and on top of it a small brasserie downstairs in which we had a good lunch. A place to return to...ThanX friend!

Reviews.Title: “Fashion view indeed, nice location”
Reviews.Author: J_Petterssons
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend to shop and look for museums. The location was spot on! Around the corner of the Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum and at the center of the famous luxerious fashion shops of Amsterdam, me and especially my wife couldn't ask for more. We had a nice welkom for starters and enjoyed a free drink at the lively brasserie downstairs. The rooms were clean and tidy (maybe they have read some old reviews and acted accordingly) and have a stylish look. Roomrates were dropped significantly so value is a big plus. I have read some bad reviews, but in my opinion there was nothing bad to remark.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, run-down, and terribly run”
Reviews.Author: DaneP
Reviews.Content: It's almost not even worth taking the time to write a review, since I'm sure this place won't be in business much longer. My stay there was terrible from start to finish. Even though the hotel opened recently, the room was already in a state of bad repair, with scratch marks everywhere--all over the walls, furniture, etc. Balls of hair, lint, and dirt along the wall, with an empty candy bag. Phone unplugged. I asked for a taxi for the next morning, since I had an early plane to catch, and they promised to book one for me. I checked multiple times to confirm, since the staff appeared incompetent, and they assured me each time that a taxi would be waiting for me at 6:45 am. When I checked out, no taxi was waiting, and they had clearly forgotten to call for one. Endless delays waiting for a cab to be called, with me locked outside in pouring rain to wait for the cab. Nothing like barely making it onto on an 8-hour international flight soaked (my luggage was drenched as well), due to the sheer and total incompetency of the hotel staff. This place is a disaster--avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: pjellyNewYork
Reviews.Content: I read a very positive review about this hotel in NY Times and decided to book a room for 4 nights for a week long European vacation with my wife. When my wife and I arrived early at 7am in the morning on a Friday the receptionist said our room check in was 2PM. We knew that but asked kindly if there was a possibility of an early check in. "No" the woman replied its 2PM there is nothing we can do. Not even an attempt to look into this or to offer us up a warm hello and a map of the city, the woman was downright rude. We considered booking another hotel but when we went downstairs to the hotel's cafe a terrific waiter there (the only positive item in our stay) offered to figure out what the problem was and within 10 minutes we had a room -- imagine that. Things did not improve from then on -- the hotel was not clean and the service was less than adequate. We asked for new towels one day and mysteriously our dirty towels were gone from the room several hours later and no new ones replaced. We asked for a wake up call one morning and no wake up call. This consistent poor customer service continued every day. It felt as though the hotel staff felt as though we were an imposition. The location of the hotel was pleasant although we would have preferred something a little more central. But even without that the hotel itself was beyond poor.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, nasty service”
Reviews.Author: katgut
Reviews.Content: I am honestly shocked that 15 people found this hotel a good experience. My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in one of their "attic" rooms and were disgusted with the bad service, but first the room.... We're new yorkers so we're used to small rooms, but this was probably smaller than any room I have EVER stayed in. There was basically a platform bed and nothing else -- no closet, no storage, nowhere to sit, nowhere to move. This might be ok if you're in town for a day, but completely uncomfortable if you're staying a while. Also the whole place felt like it was faling apart - everything needed a paint job, the lights didn't work properly and every single door squeaked. Finally when we first came into our room the toilet hadn't been properly flushed or cleaned, yuck! The hotel itself is really not a "hotel" -- there is no common space at all, no downstairs reception (you need a key to enter or be buzzed in, unfortunately the buzzer didn't work), the elevator only fits 2 people at one time, no room service, no internet, etc. And finally the service....I have never come across a more unpleasant assistant mgr! This woman told us off because after arriving early and jet lagged we asked if we could check in early. She lied about the availability of our room and only later let us in. Any time we asked for something - a towel (the maid took them away but didnt replace them), toilet paper - we would get blank looks and nothing. Everything was a chore! These people really shouldn't be running a hotel. The only positive and the reason I gave this hotel 2 stars is because the associated cafe is lovely and the waitstaff were fantastic, giving us helpful recommendations for the town. Those guys made our stay bearable. Beware -- I would AVOID this hotel with so many equally proced options on the canals.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: jtmimii
Reviews.Content: I must say the hotel is very charming and great to stay. good location and easy to around. the hotel stuff are very friendly and helpful with all the requests i asked. but i have to say that, the waiter (an asian guy) who work at the breakfast cafe is very arrogant and not friendly. he is simply a person that u dont wish to see first thing in the morning. he just spoiled your day. i really really think he should not be part of the hotel. he did not lift up to the hotel standard. please tell him to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoseLou
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I found the Hotel Patou to be perfect for a city break. Minutes from the museums and Vondelpark and within walking distance of the centre of Amsterdam, the hotel was located in a fashionable yet quiet area which was well serviced by local bars and restaurants . We stayed in Room 23 a stylish and comfortable double room with a small but chic bathroom. The layout of the hotel means that you can access your bedroom without passing the front desk giving a feeling of seculsion which was quite refreshing for us since we both travel for work and usually stay in large hotels. The only downsides were not major drawbacks for a short leisure break . Wardrobe space is very limited for two people for more than a couple of nights and the lighting whilst atmospheric, was not as flexible as it could have been. The Patou is a small and modern but not sterile boutique hotel on the doorstep of a lovely, relaxed and up market area. We got an excellent rate on the internet and it was a hotel that enhanced rather than detracted from our weekend break !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, dozy staff”
Reviews.Author: FreidaBrussels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Patou hotel for a weekend in July. We were in a superiour room - which size-wise for Amsterdam wasn't bad (meaning it was about 3 times the size of the bed overall). The room had a modern/minimalist decor - but could have done with some re-painting as there were lots of bangs etc. When we arrived, we asked the guy at reception a few questions about the local area, how to get places etc - he was half asleep - couldn't answer any of them. Happily there was someone else at reception who answered for us. The next day at breakfast, same thing - the waiter had clearly had a very hard night - he managed to mix up all our order (which wasn't very complex), and then hung out in a corner avoiding our looks as we tried to get more coffee. That aside, the hotel is really nice, in a very good location, and for Amsterdam, is good value for money. I will probably stay there again when I go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: txsunshine06
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The hotel is on a very lovely street with quite a few high end shops. The location is great as it is so close to vondel Park, Leidseplein, the Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh Museum. The tram lines No. 1 and 5 are just up the street and so convenient for getting around Amsterdam. The room was very nice, clean and modern. The bathroom was modern and very clean. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and it was very good. I liked the fact that the hotel entrance was not so obvious. I felt very safe in this hotel and in this area of Amsterdam. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minoue-Sisteron
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean boutique hotel on one of the most posh street in Amsterdam. Close to Gogh Museum and 10 min to Leidseplein, where there are many restaurants and bars. The only thing you might notice is that windows are not double-glazed, so you could hear noise from outside. But basically it is a quiet neighbourhood and should not be any problem. It might be difficult to find entrance since it is in first floor, but continental breakfast in bar/restaurant is a nice way to start exploring the city. Definitely recommended for visitors looking for decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: khtravels
Reviews.Content: Stylish room in a great neighborhood. Near Vondel Park and Museums. Front desk staff very helpful especially Klas? who was wonderful with arranging a few out of town excursions and giving very good suggestions for restaurants. I would definitely stay there again. Off the typical tourist path, but convenient to everything with many tram lines nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissOrgana
Reviews.Content: Quite different to any hotel I have previously stayed in. Strange entrance/ reception area, but rooms are absolutely immaculate and very tastefully designed. Staff are very friendly and very interested in your opinion of the hotel/ any problems you had etc. I got a deal in which i got a deluxe room for the price of a standard, and to be honest I expected it to be a bit bigger, but it is still more than adequate for 2 people. It is within walking distance of the main shopping area, pubs and restaurants. The metro is around the corner which brings you to central station, dam square and the red light district, although we only got it on arrival and when we were leaving as it is easy enough to walk anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights around the holidays and really liked the hotel. Rooms are well decorated, modern and very clean. There is a safe, minibar and flat screen tv. Service at the desk was very friendly. However, if you have mobility problems, hotel stairs are extremely steep and elevator tiny. The free breakfast buffet was ok, but choice could be a bit more varied. The hotel is well situated, on nice shopping street, not too far from restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel and the service”
Reviews.Author: traveller3530
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during the new years eve, it was a excellent experience. the hotel rooms have a good design, and is located just 2 minutes walk from Vondel park and is in the prime shopping area of amsterdam, where you will find the best shops like Channel. Gucci etc. We walked around the hotel and walked passed it twice as it has a very small door which opens by ringig a bell, then we reach the reception on the 1st floor , where the staff is friendly and charming, very helpful tries to do all they can to help. i remember the name of only Brenda, who was very efficient right from the time i booked the hotel, the service is very professional, the breakfast is next to the hotel in a brassire which is also quite good. the room is nice and very modern, toilets clean and with all the acceiorires, all in all a fantastic experience. would definately come here again.

Reviews.Title: “New, godd location, small rooms but OK”
Reviews.Author: dottorsocrates
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small, design hotel located in the area of the fashion district in Amsterdam. The hotel opened in 2007 and has only 12 rooms. The entrance of the hotel is a little bit stragen since you ring at a door and you have access to a little and narrow aisle that drives you to the elevator. The elevator brings you to the first florr where the reception is. Rooms, as in most of the Amsterdam hotels, are quite small, but I had one located on the roof, so I got a good view. The hotel is brand new and the room is done in a stlish way. The bathroom was very small but it had all the amenities like soap, bathrobe, slippers etc... Price was not so cheap since I paid â‚¬140 but it was during a fair, during this period most of the hotels raise their prices. Breakfast is at the brasserie of the hotel located at the ground floor next to the entrance.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Patou
HotelInfo.Address: P.C. Hooftstraat 63, Amsterdam 1071 BN, The Netherlands
